title: Pinnebog River
text:
The Pinnebog River is a <a href="river">river</a> in the <a href="The%20Thumb">Thumb</a> region of the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Michigan">Michigan</a>. The river flows into <a href="Lake%20Huron">Lake Huron</a> on the west side of the "tip" of the "thumb".
The entire length of the Pinnebog lies within <a href="Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Huron County</a> and is fed by various agricultural ditches and drains. It is formed by the confluence of the Colona and Colfax drains near the southern boundary of <a href="section%20%28land%29">section</a> 28 in <a href="Colfax%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Colfax Township</a>, on the south side of <a href="M-53%20%28Michigan%20highway%29">M-53</a> (Van Dyke Rd.) about south-southwest of <a href="Bad%20Axe%2C%20Michigan">Bad Axe</a>. It flows southwest for about around the <a href="unincorporated%20community">unincorporated community</a> of <a href="Popple%2C%20Michigan">Popple</a> where it is fed by the Cameron and McLean drains. It then bends northward around Popple and flows northwest for about past the east side of the village of <a href="Elkton%2C%20Michigan">Elkton</a>. North of Elkton, the river flows mostly northward to its mouth in Lake Huron in <a href="Port%20Crescent%20State%20Park">Port Crescent State Park</a> at , about southwest of <a href="Port%20Austin%2C%20Michigan">Port Austin</a>. Other tributaries include the Elkton Drain, Nettle Run, Hill Drain, Southworth Drain, McMullen Drain, Oliver Drain, Bad Axe Creek, Musselman Drain (which empties Rush Lake in the <a href="Rush%20Lake%20State%20Game%20Area">Rush Lake State Game Area</a>. Before reaching Lake Huron, it turns to flow east-northeast for about to its mouth. Just before its mouth, it is joined by the Taft and Schram drains.
The river's watershed drains all or portions of the following townships: 
<a href="Bingham%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Bingham</a>, 
<a href="Chandler%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Chandler</a>, 
<a href="Colfax%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Colfax</a>, 
<a href="Dwight%20Township%2C%20Michigan">Dwight</a>,
<a href="Hume%20Township%2C%20Michigan">Hume</a>, 
<a href="Lake%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Lake</a>, 
<a href="Lincoln%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Lincoln</a>, 
<a href="Meade%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Meade</a>, 
<a href="Oliver%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Oliver</a>, 
<a href="Sheridan%20Township%2C%20Huron%20County%2C%20Michigan">Sheridan</a>, and 
<a href="Verona%20Township%2C%20Michigan">Verona</a>.
The <a href="unincorporated%20community">unincorporated community</a> of <a href="Pinnebog%2C%20Michigan">Pinnebog</a> is situated on the Taft Drain. The Pinnebog River passes about to the west. Pinnebog Road runs from north of Pinnebog due south about to Van Dyke Road just north of Popple. Pinnebog Road is also designated as County Road L for its entire length.
